treatment.reference: Patellamide A and C biosynthesis by a microcin-like pathway in Prochloron didemni, the cyanobacterial symbiont of Lissoclinum patella (Schmidt, E., et al., 2005)
treatment.description: obligate cyanobacterial symbionts of many didemnid family ascidians, use both chlorophylls a and b for photosynthesis, lack phycobilins, and have plant-like thylakoids, The cells are relatively large for bacteria (10–20 μm in diameter)
